channel.title: Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2 "roadkill.ff"
channel.description: I just got MW2 for PC(yes i have the correct specs), and I crash as soon as the little intro-ish thing ends with "roadkill.ff". Right now I'm reinstalling (via Disk.) and I was wondering if it was just a little problem that happened while I first had installed it or if it was a serious problem I can't fix and I need to pay another $59.99 for a new copy.

item.description:

i am not a huge fan of call of duty but this was awesome!

item.title: Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2 "roadkill.ff"
item.dc:creator: Daedalus
item.description:
RabidMonkey:

You can also save yourself a reinstall by telling Steam to verify game cache integrity…that solves 99% of errors related to problems with a game’s data files.

He tried that, (he mentioned it earlier) it didn’t work.

Read full topic

item.title: Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2 "roadkill.ff"
item.dc:creator: RabidMonkey
item.description:
SoaringScout:

Solved it. Whatever file is giving you trouble, you have to look for it and delete it. Steam will automatically download a good copy of the file.

You can also save yourself a reinstall by telling Steam to verify game cache integrity…that solves 99% of errors related to problems with a game’s data files.

func_random:

Good ol’ Steam. If ever I need to clear out some useful game saves, or I am going for the final push on cp_gravelpit, Steam finds a way to crash my game, delete my stuff, or, more annoyingly, strip me of my unlockable weapons, delete them, and then piss on my desktop with advertisements for games who do not even have mothers for me to insult.

sounds like a problem with the game, not the distribution platform, maybe that’s just me though

Read full topic

item.title: Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2 "roadkill.ff"
item.dc:creator: Master_Chef
item.description:
Add the game to your Steam list. I know that I got Dark Messiah of Might and Magic through retail, but since it is a Steam supported game, I could upload it onto the games list on my Steam page, and now I don’t need the disc to play anymore. You should try that.

Read full topic

item.title: Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2 "roadkill.ff"
item.dc:creator: Brian118
item.description:
Ok, My friend and I have both been having this same issue recently. What you have to do is just WAIT for like 3-5 min after the screen turns black. The menu will eventually come up. I have no idea why it’s doing this…I think it is related to a recent update.

Read full topic

Read full topic

item.title: Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2 "roadkill.ff"
item.dc:creator: loony636
item.description:
SoaringScout:

I just got MW2 for PC(yes i have the correct specs), and I crash as soon as the little intro-ish thing ends with “roadkill.ff”. Right now I’m reinstalling (via Disk.) and I was wondering if it was just a little problem that happened while I first had installed it or if it was a serious problem I can’t fix and I need to pay another $59.99 for a new copy.

Buying another copy of the game wont fix your problem. Steam does an integrity check of the game files every time you launch the game, so if the game files aren’t 100% exactly the same as the files on the master Steam server, then the game wont load. Even for single player games.

Hence, downloading the game or reinstalling it wont do anything. Your problem lies elsewhere.

So you can’t access any of the in-game menus? Have you tried launching the game in safe mode? What are the specs of your computer? And, more importantly, does the game give any error when it crashes? Anything at all?

Dr. Strangelove:

Try uninstalling and throwing out the disk.

There’s always one douchebag in every forum thread. Lovely; thanks for your contribution.

Read full topic

item.title: Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2 "roadkill.ff"
item.dc:creator: Crikulus
item.description:
Requiem From modernwarfareforum.com:

I also looked in F:\Program Files\Valve\Steam\steamapps\common\call of duty modern warfare 2\zone\english and I see a big list of maps and roadkill.ff is there.

I fixed the problem by reinstalling. >.<

abc From modernwarfareforum.com:

I was gonna say… easiest issue ever, just misread the file when you installed so try reinstalling.

Read full topic

item.title: Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2 "roadkill.ff"
item.dc:creator: Dillxn
item.description:
I sincerely doubt it’s related to your copy of the game. The last thing in the world that you need to do is buy a new one.

Read full topic

item.title: Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2 "roadkill.ff"
item.dc:creator: Crikulus
item.description:
Alot of times, problems that occur right after the loading screens can be graphical, because the loading sequences are just videos being played. So try to update all your graphics drivers and any other related software that may need updating. If it’s a problem with your copy there’s no way you need to pay that much again, just bring it back and say it didn’t work.

Read full topic
